intro: Malvastrum wilczekii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
